text: What techniques or services do you use for clients to send you passwords easily? For example, if you need logins to a client's  FTP, domain registrar etc.

We use basecamp for alot of communications but normally its clients sending up their stuff either through that or though email and we log it in a central place like a shared one note book or something

We do basically the same - if we need to send a password however we use droplr which lets you create a temporary url where they can view the password. We set the page to self destruct within a day or two and password protect the page with a simple password the person has to type in to view the password weâ€™re sending them.
Thanks! I wish there was a more "secure" way. I'm tired of hearing this from clients lol
i've used that when i've had to send documents over that have sensitive info on it
Thanks <@U2H3TT8F2>! I am definitely going to check it out
Anyone got a mobile/slideout nav they like a lot that plays nice with advanced menus?

I used to use <https://mmenu.frebsite.nl/> but it requires some tricks to get it to work perfectly with drag n drop templates because it needs to inject a wrapper around the whole page to make it work
Now I just roll my own.
